page.title: 12Westonzoyland Airfield
page.content: The airfield to the north of the village was originally established just after the First World War when it was used for training purposes by the R.F.C. At that time it consisted of grass strips and tented accomodation. At the outbreak of the Second World War large areas of land were compulsory purchased by the War Ministry, and a much larger airfield with concrete runways and permanent buildings was constructed. During the war the R.A.F. and U.S.A.F. used the airfield mainly for bomber squadrons, although towards the end it was used for training glider pilots for the Arnhiem Raid. The airfield was closed in 1954. Much of the land was reclaimed for agriculture but there are still large areas of runway left which are used for private aircraft and even for flying model aircraft.
